From: Cisco IOS Configuration Fundamentals Command Reference
FuncDef: To set the escape character for the current terminal line for the current session, use the **terminalÂ escape-character** command in EXEC mode.

ParaDef.Info: ASCII decimal representation of the escape character or control sequence (for example, Ctrl-P ).

Examples: In the following example, the escape character to Ctrl-P (ASCII decimal character 16) for the current session:
ExtraInfo: See the ["ASCII Character Set and Hexidecimal Values"](http://www.cisco.com/en/US/docs/ios/fundamentals/command/reference/cf_ap1.html) appendix for a list of ASCII characters and their numerical representation.This command is useful, for example, if you have the default escape character defined for a different purpose in your keyboard file. Entering the escape character followed by the X key returns you to EXEC mode when you are connected to another computer.![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/note.gif)---**Note** ![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/blank.gif)The Break key generally cannot be used as an escape character on the console terminal because the operating software interprets the Break command on a console line as an instruction to halt the system.---
